text: Model name: Northstar CECL Suite v4.2. Model type: CECL/IFRS9 (credit risk allowance model under ASC 326).
Primary estimation technique: Cash Flow Analysis using a hybrid PD/LGD/EAD framework with lifetime projection and discounting.
Model developer: Northstar Analytics. Model owner: Finance Controllership - Allowance Methodology Lead, with Credit Risk oversight.
Risk rating: Tier 1 (Critical), because the model directly supports CECL allowance estimation and reporting.
Model validator: Client Model Risk Management (MRM) team. Validation date and validation rating are maintained in client governance records and are not explicitly listed in the vendor documents.
Business purpose and usage: produce month-end and quarter-end CECL allowance estimates for finance close, governance, and board/regulatory reporting support.
Regulatory and policy coverage: ASC 326 (CECL), SR 11-7 model risk guidance, OCC 2011-12, and internal model risk governance policy.
Business units using this model: Risk Management, Operations, Retail Banking, and Commercial Banking. Finance Controllership is the primary reporting consumer.

Upstream inputs come from loan accounting, servicing/collections, recoveries, collateral, and macro scenario feeds. Downstream consumers include allowance reporting, GL control reconciliation, and model risk governance packs.
Key model drivers include delinquency status, charge-off and recovery behavior, collateral position, utilization/payment behavior, and macroeconomic scenario assumptions.
Data sources are a mix of internal and external feeds: internal loan, servicing, collections, recoveries, collateral, and GL control data plus curated macroeconomic scenario datasets.
Model outputs include lifetime ECL results, PD/LGD/EAD component outputs, driver attribution, QC exceptions, run metadata, and auditable evidence artifacts.
Scenario governance: runs are tied to named forecast packages with documented scenario sets, weighting choices, and close-cycle evidence of approvals and overlays.
Key assumptions and limitations: sensitivity to segmentation design, calibration choices, and scenario selection; limitations and overlays are documented with mitigating controls.
Monitoring approach: monthly data drift and performance monitoring with defined thresholds, escalation tiers, exception tracking, and evidence retention.
Change management: controlled release governance with segregation of duties, approval gates, version tracking, and documented material-change review.
Contingency and fallback process: incident response plus backup, business continuity, and disaster recovery procedures with defined recovery steps and retained run evidence.

Core intake values: model type CECL/IFRS9, estimation technique Cash Flow Analysis (hybrid PD/LGD/EAD), model developer Northstar Analytics, model owner Finance Controllership, and risk rating Tier 1 (Critical).
Operational controls: monthly monitoring, controlled change management, and documented contingency/DR procedures are in place for the CECL suite.
